messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Find whoever I contacted last, change his cell to +10293847563.
I don’t have visibility into your communication logs to know who you last contacted. Could you please tell me the name or ID of the person whose number you’d like me to update to +1 029 384 7563?
I don't know the person's name.

Could you help me identify which contact you mean? I don’t have access to call logs, so I need at least one of these to locate the right entry:

• Name (or part of it)  
• The contact’s unique ID in your address book  
• Any other detail you’ve stored (relationship, part of their old number, etc.)  

Let me know anything you recall, and I’ll update their number to +10293847563.
I don't have any more details about this person.

I’m still not able to pinpoint which contact you mean. Since you don’t have any identifying details, would you like me to pull up your full contact list so you can pick the person whose number needs updating?
I don't have the contact list with me.

messages.name: search_contacts
messages.content: ValueError: No search criteria are given. At least one search criteria should be provided among ('person_id', 'name', 'phone_number', 'relationship', 'is_self')

I still can’t pinpoint which contact to update without at least one identifier—such as their name (or part of it), the old phone number, your stored relationship to them, or their unique contact ID. If you can check your device or any notes for even a fragment of that info, let me know and I’ll make the change.
